module.name: ap239_product_status_recording
module.name.french: Enregistrement des états de produit de l'AP 239

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the observed state or status of a realized product.

This part of ISO 10303 may be used for recording the state of a realized products, including the existence of a fault, where this is viewed as an undesirable state, possibly caused by a failure event. An observed state may also be related to the activity that was being performed when the state was recognised. The observed state may be assessed against a state definition. The assignment of the observed state may be justified. The module may also be used to assign a location to an identified product, a product group or an attachment slot, and to record observations relating to any of the above.
This part of ISO 10303 provides the following capabilities:

ul.li: assignment of an observed state to an identified product or product group;
assignment of an observed state to a connection, interface or other relationship between two products;
relating an activity to the assignment of an observed state;
assignment of a justification for an observed state;
assignment of a location to a product or product group;
assignment of an activity to the assessment of an observed state;
addition of an product or product group to the context for an observation;
association of a translation in a particular language of an observation and observation consequence.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 uses the capabilities of the following significant modules:
The module enables representation of an observed state, including the existence of a fault.

The module enables the recording of observed facts. It is used in this part of ISO 10303 to collected other information of relevance to the product who's state is being recorded. The module enables an observation to be recorded in more than one language.

The module is used in this part of ISO 10303 to relate the observation or state to the activity being performed when the information was collected. The activity may itself be linked to a work definition for an inspection or other type of task.
The is used to assign a location to a realized product.
The module is used to relate a justification to the assignment of an observed state.
The , and modules are used to identify the item to which the observed state applies.
The module is used to provide the configuration definition information of the product.

inscope.li: assignment of an observed state to an identified product or product group;
assignment of an observed state to a connection, interface or other relationship between two products;
relating an activity to the assignment of an observed state;
assignment of a justification for an observed state;
assignment of a location to a product or product group;
assignment of an activity to the assessment of an observed state;
addition of an product or product group to the context for an observation;
association of a translation in a particular language of an observation and observation consequence.

outscope.li: assignment of property to an identified state or individual state;
recording of the transition of product data to a particular state as an event;
recording the usage of a product;
